Headed to the Harvard Club to participate in a panel called Strategies for Thriving In a Market Meltdown. I"ll tweet the best ones I hear
Surviving Meltdown quote: pretend you are your successor and do what he or she would do
Surviving Meltdown quote: craft your business model to meet the needs of the market not to satisfy potential investors

WSJ (europe) says govt loans to automakers will carry 20pcnt warrant coverage. in the case of GM, govt could end up owning 40pcnt of GM
Oh yeah! I fished out an apple airline power adapter from the bottom of my bag and now have power for the flight home to nyc. Pack rat ftw
kind of interesting, i avg 6 posts per day on tumblr and twitter and 2.3 on typepad. would have thought twitter > tumblr but it's not
to wrap; typepad 64 months & 4,423 posts, tumblr 17 months & 3,370 posts, twitter 22 months & 4,004 posts. microblogging is easier
the other interesting stat would be the length of time i've been tumblogging and the number of tumblr posts. not sure if i can find that
been blogging since sept 2003 and have written 4,423 posts. been twittering since spring 2007 and have written 4,002 posts, 4,003 now

holy shit. christmas just came early for the NY Jets and their fans, including me and Josh
